reviews.review_msg: Just a great all around professor, and one of the best at SFU. Funny, well-spoken and engaging.  He allows students to conjure up their own theories, and supports them to the fullest degree. Highly, highly recommended.

It is interesting how there is a series of comments with the same chatty, conversational style of writing that offer praise to Nadine while emphasizing what she expects from her students. Could it be Nadine pretending to be students? I am convinced it is, but you be the judge.

Classes were dry and it felt like I was in a bad re-run since classes were so repetitive. I'm an English Major and expect a hefty reading list,  but her expectations were far beyond manageable, even for a 300 level class. To add to this, the readings were BORING. For a class called 'Pop Lit', I expected something more exciting than what she offered
Jon Smith is one of the best English professors at SFU in my opinion. Write a solid essay and you'll get solid feeback. His lectures are enjoyable and he's knowledgeable about what he teaches.

Dr. Smith was a delight! I took his class on Popular Literature and Culture, with a focus on the TV Show Buffy the Vampire Slayer). Dr. Smith is a passionate professor and made a 4-hour evening seminar quite enjoyable and insightful. As someone who is not an English major, I deeply valued his feedback on my papers, although his comments were blunt.
Loved the material put together for this class. Included books And movies. Really enjoyed it. Very passionate about his teaching. Gave Very good clues as to what would be on the final.

He has been the most amazing prof i have ever had.  Always engaged the seminar in discussion to the point where everyone was engaged.  Clearly some of the reviewers on here don't understand university yet, or what makes an excellent class/prof. will continue to take classes with him

He has been the most amazing prof i have ever had.  Always engaged the seminar in discussion to the point where everyone was engaged.  Clearly some of the reviewers on here don't understand university yet, or what makes an excellent class/prof. will continue to take classes with him

Karyn is a wonderful professor, her lectures are entertaining and informative. The ONLY thing that would keep me from taking her courses are this group of girls who appear in all of her courses. They are morons, they usually have no interest in the books but love chatting, bringing in personal anecdotes to excuse their idiocy

TAKE HIS CLASSES. He is my favourite prof; extremely funny, engaging, approachable, and discussion-oriented. He does a great job of making every class fun and thought-provoking. I took his gaming class as someone that NEVER games, and still found it extremely interesting and filled with opportunities for participation. He's super passionate.

Budras teaching is nebulous and lacks a clear, cohesive theme. While he does share readings that are meant to solidify our understanding of certain game terminology, the way he leads discussions often results in vague, insubstantial conclusions. He also does not offer a clear grading rubric, nor any immediate feedback for some assignments.

Sophie's class sounded interesting but wasn't really very well put together. Readings were irrelevant and it felt like the class got less organized as we went on. She seemed to have a superficial grasp of some of the readings and preferred her own interpretations over opposing ones. OTOH, she is friendly, intelligent, and challenges her students.
